- Esperienza comprovata in migrazioni di Data Warehouse e consolidamento di sistemi legacy.

- Padronanza di SQL avanzato e strumenti di ETL.
- Esperienza con Oracle (per il profilo 1) o con PHP / sistemi ETL custom / data flows (per il profilo 2).
- Familiarità con data mapping , data quality , integrazione tra sistemi e documentazione tecnica .
- Buona conoscenza dei principi di versionamento del codice (Git o simili).
- Capacità di lavorare in ambienti Linux-based e con strumenti di automazione dei processi dati.
- Approccio analitico e strutturato , con attenzione ai dettagli.
- Autonomia operativa e capacità di problem solving in contesti complessi.
- Comunicazione chiara, collaborazione e disponibilità al confronto tecnico.
- Capacità di lavorare efficacemente in team distribuiti e in lingua inglese .



COSA OFFRIAMO:

- Contratto a tempo indeterminato con buoni pasto e indennità.
- Strumenti di formazione tecnica e manageriale per sviluppare le competenze hard e soft.
- Follow-up costante con il team HR per supportare la tua crescita professionale.

The Field Service Engineer will support customers across the UK and mainland Europe by performing regular maintenance, repair, and refurbishment of laboratory instruments, which include pharmaceutical laboratories, research institutions, and pharmaceutical manufacturing facilities and others.



Must be currently based in France, Germany, or Switzerland to apply.



PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

- FPLC/HPLC and Bioprocess, Microplate Readers, Microplate Washers, Genevac® Evaporators, Typhoon® Imaging Systems, Incubators, Surface Plasmon Resonance, and Centrifuges experience required.
- Perform preventative maintenance, repairs, and calibrations on laboratory instruments, as well as the refurbishment of instruments.
- Effectively communicate with customers before going on site and account team members to troubleshoot, diagnose, provide repair updates, train end-users, and ensure full resolution of all customer needs.

- Contributes to SOP formulations as needed.
- Serve as a member of the customer account team by contributing your technical expertise to resolve customer questions, troubleshoot customer issues, and identify additional opportunities to serve our customers.



QUALIFICATIONS:

- Associate's or bachelor’s degree in a major illustrating mathematical and/or engineering aptitude, OR
- High School Diploma/GED and 4 or more years of experience servicing
- No visa sponsorship, and must have a valid EU, UK passport and driver's license.

WHO WE ARE



GivePower’s (www.givepower.org) mission is to electrify the world with clean energy, and provide greater health, economic and educational opportunities to developing regions that need it most. Our growing team is made up of passionate, creative problem-solvers who value community, vision, and impact. We focus on building and operating projects that provide solar-powered solutions for improving education, water access, food production, health and conservation. We also provide life-changing voluntourism treks for donors and teams wishing to be a part of the impact they’re making. If you crave an opportunity to meaningfully improve the lives of those in need, come join the charge!



YOUR ROLE



Almost half the world’s population relies on biomass burned in the home to purify water prior to consuming it. This process produces massive amounts of carbon emissions.GivePower’s Solar Water Farm technology uses solar and battery-powered desalination to eliminate the need for boiling.As the only desalination project to be accredited by Gold Standard, the carbon credits generated are unique, measurable and substantial.



We are seeking an experienced, results-driven professional to lead the sale of carbon credits from our current inventory and future issuances. This role will focus on identifying and securing buyers interested in high quality credits that also generate tremendous social benefits including job creation, health improvement, school attendance, and more. This revenue will enable GivePower to expand its Solar Water Farm portfolio at rapid speed.



Once the credits are sold each year and prior to our next issuance, the role will pivot to support the development team in cultivating funding sources, including corporate partnerships, grants and philanthropic contributions that align with GivePower’s mission.



This is a unique opportunity for a skilled sales and business development professional to directly contribute to both climate action and life-changing humanitarian work.



RESPONSIBILITIES



Carbon Credit Sales

- Develop and execute a sales strategy to sell 50,000+ carbon credits annually
- Identify, qualify, engage and close sales with prospective buyers, including corporations, NGOs, individuals and sustainability-focused funds
- Build relationships with brokers, traders and marketplaces to expand sales channels
- Negotiate terms that maximize value for GivePower
- Track, report and forecast sales progress against targets. Ensure all agreements and pipeline activities are fully documented utilizing our CRM system.
- Represent GivePower at events that engage sustainability managers and others interested in avoiding carbon emissions via the purchase of carbon credits



Development & Fundraising Support (Between Issuances)

- Prospect, engage and close new funding sources, including grants, corporate partnerships and individual donors
- Assist in proposal writing, pitch development and donor relationship management
- Research emerging trends and funding opportunities related to climate, water and renewable energy
- Collaborate with the marketing team to prepare donor-facing materials



DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

- Proven track record in carbon credit sales, carbon markets or environmental commodities trading
- Strong network in sustainability, ESG and/or carbon offset sectors
- Excellent negotiation, relationship-building and closing skills
- Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
- Experience in nonprofit fundraising, business development or corporate partnerships
- Familiarity with renewable energy, water access and/or environmental impact projects
- Ability to present to high-level corporate stakeholders and philanthropic decision makers



PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

- Mission-driven with a passion for climate action and humanitarian impact
- Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to take initiative and create opportunities
- Adaptable and comfortable working across both sales and fundraising disciplines
- Collaborative, with the ability to work effectively across diverse teams and cultures



GivePower is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage people of every colour, orientation, age, gender, religion, origin, and ability to apply.

RSI Europe develops remote initiation systems and FPV drones; the company provides products, training and in-field support to defence customers.

- Consultative selling & presentation skills - able to run professional demonstrations, briefings and workshops with senior audiences.
- Stakeholder & programme management - able to coordinate multi-party pilots, training and delivery programmes.
- Preffered prior experience selling B2G (business-to-government) defence solutions or working within a defence integrator.
- Languages - fluent in local language and English.
- Travel - frequent travel within country and region.



Personal attributes

- Credible and confident public presence - experienced at briefing senior officials and technical teams.
- Commercial drive with high ethical standards and diplomacy.
- Pragmatic problem solver, resilient under pressure, and able to manage long-cycle sales and complex stakeholder landscapes.



Security & compliance

- Opportunity to lead a fast-growing, battle-proven defence-tech company’s expansion in Italy.
- Engage with top-tier military professionals and defense agencies worldwide.
- High level of autonomy.
- Competitive senior package, performance incentives and travel allowance.
